title: Run the 'JWSACruncher' with rjwsacruncher
text: use rjwsacruncher need download JWACruncher. available https://github.com/jdemetra/jdemetra-app/releases (JDemetra+ 2.x.y versions) https://github.com/jdemetra/jdplus-main/releases (JDemetra+ 3.x.y versions). can also downloaded function download_cruncher(): configure JWSACruncher portable version Java can use function configure_jwsacruncher(). See ?configure_jwsacruncher informations. run JWSACruncher need three files: “.param” file containing refresh policy items seasonal adjustment export; valid JDemetra+ workspace; path JWSACruncher. rjwsacruncher, four functions associated run JWSACruncher: create_param_file() list2param_file() create “.param” parameter file; cruncher() run JWSACruncher workspace parameter file; cruncher_and_param() run ‘JWSACruncher’ workspace creating parameter file; update_workspace() update workspace without exporting results.
code: library(rjwsacruncher) # Directory where to save the JWSACruncher: directory <- tempdir() download_cruncher(directory) # for JDemetra+ 3.x.y versions : download_cruncher(directory, v3 = TRUE)

what: Create the parameter file with create_param_file()
title: Run the 'JWSACruncher' with rjwsacruncher
text: parameters function create_param_file() described wiki JWSACruncher: https://github.com/jdemetra/jwsacruncher/wiki. three important parameters create_param_file() : policy refresh policy (see table ). Refresh policies matrix_item character containing items matrix output. default, items defined option default_matrix_item exported. change can change option default_matrix_item parameter matrix_item: tsmatrix_series character containing names times series export. default, items defined option default_tsmatrix_series exported. change can change option default_tsmatrix_series parameter tsmatrix_series: informations, see help function: ?create_param_file. examples create parameter file: Parameter files can read read_param_file() returns list can also modified exported list2param_file(): default parameters files JDemetra+ 2.x.y JDemetra+ 3.x.y can retrieved default_param_file().
code: # To get the default parameters getOption("default_matrix_item") # To change the default parameters to, for example, only export # the information criteria: options(default_matrix_item = c("likelihood.aic",                                 "likelihood.aicc",                                 "likelihood.bic",                                 "likelihood.bicc")) # To get the default parameters getOption("default_tsmatrix_series") # To change the default parameters to, for example, only export # the seasonally adjusted series and its forecasts: options(default_tsmatrix_series = c("sa", "sa_f")) export_dir <- tempdir() # To create the file parameters.params in the directory export_dir with # the refresh policy "lastoutliers" and the others default parameters: create_param_file(dir_file_param = export_dir,                   policy = "lastoutliers")  # If the options "default_matrix_item" and "default_tsmatrix_series" were # changed to only export the information criteria, the seasonally adjusted series and its forecasts, the previous code is equivalent to: create_param_file(dir_file_param = export_dir,                   policy = "lastoutliers",                   matrix_item = c("likelihood.aic", "likelihood.aicc",                                   "likelihood.bic", "likelihood.bicc"),                   tsmatrix_series = c("sa", "sa_f")) param_f <- read_param_file(file.path(export_dir, "parameters.param")) str(param_f) ## List of 7 ##  $ config         :List of 4 ##   ..$ bundle       : chr "10000" ##   ..$ csv_layout   : chr "list" ##   ..$ csv_separator: chr ";" ##   ..$ ndecs        : chr "6" ##  $ policy         : chr "lastoutliers" ##  $ refreshall     : logi TRUE ##  $ output         : NULL ##  $ matrix_item    : chr [1:4] "likelihood.aic" "likelihood.aicc" "likelihood.bic" "likelihood.bicc" ##  $ tsmatrix_series: chr [1:2] "sa" "sa_f" ##  $ paths_path     : NULL

title: Run the 'JWSACruncher' with rjwsacruncher
text: run JWSACruncher cruncher() cruncher_and_param(), specify path JWSACruncher (cruncher_bin_directory parameter) path workspace (workspace parameter). default, path JWSACruncher value option cruncher_bin_directory: therefore change option applies future running. path specify folder containing jwsacruncher.bat file “Bin” folder JWSACruncher. Thus, installed D:\jdemetra-cli-2.2.2, file jwsacruncher.bat D:\jdemetra-cli-2.2.2\bin change cruncher_bin_directory option follows: workspace specified, dialog box opens select . cruncher_and_param() function allows create temporary parameter file create_param_file() run JWSACruncher cruncher(). addition parameters available two functions, cruncher_and_param() allows rename output folder containing workspace results equal names multi-documents displayed JDemetra+ software parameter rename_multi_documents (equals FALSE default). examples:
code: options(cruncher_bin_directory = "D:/jdemetra-cli-2.2.2/bin/") # The following code updates the workspace "workspace", that is under the folder D:/,  # with the refresh policy "lastoutliers". Others parameters are the default ones of create_param_file(). # In particular, the exported parameters are those of the options # "default_matrix_item" options and "default_tsmatrix_series" and the results  # will be under D:/workspace/Output/. cruncher_and_param(workspace = "D:/workspace.xml",                    policy = "lastoutliers")  # Use the parameter "outpout" to change the folder that will contains the results cruncher_and_param(workspace = "D:/workspace.xml",                    output = "D:/Results/",                    policy = "lastoutliers")  # To change the names of the folders containing the outputs so that they are equal # to the names of the multi-documents displayed in JDemetra+, use the parameter # "rename_multi_documents = TRUE". The parameter "delete_existing_file = TRUE" # allows to delete any existing folders with the same name as the multi-documents. cruncher_and_param(workspace = "D:/workspace.xml",                    rename_multi_documents = TRUE,                    delete_existing_file = TRUE,                    policy = "lastoutliers")  # To see the other parameters: ?cruncher_and_param

title: Authors and Citation
text: Alain Quartier-la-Tente. Author, maintainer. Institut national de la statistique et des études économiques. Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Quartier-la-Tente (2025). rjwsacruncher: Interface 'JWSACruncher' 'JDemetra+'. R package version 0.2.3, https://aqlt.github.io/rjwsacruncher/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rjwsacruncher: Interface to the 'JWSACruncher' of 'JDemetra+'},   author = {Alain Quartier-la-Tente},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.3},   url = {https://aqlt.github.io/rjwsacruncher/}, }

what: Interface to the JWSACruncher of JDemetra+
title: Interface to the JWSACruncher of JDemetra+
text: goal rjwsacruncher launch quickly easily JWSACruncher JDemetra+. JWSACruncher console tool allows update JDemetra+ workspace export results without open JDemetra+. details JWSACruncher can found https://github.com/jdemetra/jwsacruncher/wiki.

title: Interface to the JWSACruncher of JDemetra+
text: JWSACruncher included package. can downloaded GitHub (https://github.com/jdemetra/jwsacruncher/releases https://github.com/jdemetra/jdplus-main/releases) function download_cruncher(): Since version 2.2.0, JWSACruncher needs Java 8 higher run. install (example security reasons) can install portable version ‘Java’ (require administrator rights) configure JWSACruncher use portable version function configure_jwsacruncher().
code: # Install release version from CRAN install.packages("rjwsacruncher")  # Install development version: install.packages("rjwsacruncher", repos = c("https://aqlt.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org")) # Or : # install.packages("devtools") # devtools::install_github("AQLT/rjwsacruncher") library(rjwsacruncher) # Directory where to save the JWSACruncher: directory <- tempdir() download_cruncher(directory)

title: Interface to the JWSACruncher of JDemetra+
text: JWSACruncher can easily runned function cruncher_and_param(). use , path “Bin” folder JWSACruncher defined. example, JWSACruncher D:/jdemetra-cli-2.2.3/: export items can changed function “default_matrix_item” “default_tsmatrix_series”: run JWSACruncher workspace D:/workspace.xml refresh policy “lastoutliers”:
code: options(cruncher_bin_directory = "D:/jdemetra-cli-2.2.3/bin/") # To get the default values: head(getOption("default_matrix_item")) #> [1] "period"       "span.start"   "span.end"     "span.n"       "span.missing" #> [6] "espan.start" getOption("default_tsmatrix_series") #> [1] "y"    "t"    "sa"   "s"    "i"    "ycal" # To only export the seasonally adjusted series and its forecasts: options(default_tsmatrix_series = c("sa", "sa_f")) cruncher_and_param(workspace = "D:/workspace.xml",                    policy = "lastoutliers")

what: Configure the 'JWSACruncher' with a portable version of 'Java' — configure_jwsacruncher
title: Configure the 'JWSACruncher' with a portable version of 'Java' — configure_jwsacruncher
text: Function configure 'JWSACruncher' portable version 'Java'.

title: Configure the 'JWSACruncher' with a portable version of 'Java' — configure_jwsacruncher
code: configure_jwsacruncher(jwsacruncher_path, java_path)

title: Configure the 'JWSACruncher' with a portable version of 'Java' — configure_jwsacruncher
text: jwsacruncher_path Path file jwsacruncher.bat 'JWSACruncher' (see details). java_path Path file java.exe portable version 'Java' (see details).

title: Configure the 'JWSACruncher' with a portable version of 'Java' — configure_jwsacruncher
text: Since version 2.2.0, 'JWSACruncher' needs 'Java' 8 higher run. versions 3.0.0 higher, 'JWSACruncher' needs 'Java' 17 higher. 'Windows' versions 3.0.0 higher 'JWSACruncher' includes portable version 'Java'. lower version 'JWSACruncher', install 'Java' (example security reasons) can install portable version 'Java' (require administrator rights) configure 'JWSACruncher' use portable version. : Unzip downloaded file 'JWSACruncher'; Open, Text Editor, file jwsacruncher.bat sub-folder /bin/ 'JWSACruncher'; Edit line 71 contains "%JAVACMD%"=="" set JAVACMD=java replace java path file java.exe portable version. example, portable version 'Java' installed D:/Software/Java, path java.exe D:/Software/Java/bin/java.exe new line 71 "%JAVACMD%"=="" set JAVACMD="D:\Software\Java\bin\java.exe". function configure_jwsacruncher() steps 2 3.

what: Create parameter file for the 'JWSACruncher' — create_param_file
title: Create parameter file for the 'JWSACruncher' — create_param_file
text: run 'JWSACruncher' needs parameter file create_param_file allows create .

title: Create parameter file for the 'JWSACruncher' — create_param_file
code: create_param_file(   dir_file_param,   bundle = 10000,   csv_layout = "list",   csv_separator = ";",   ndecs = 6,   full_series_name = TRUE,   short_column_headers = TRUE,   rslt_name_level = 2,   policy = "parameters",   refreshall = TRUE,   output = NULL,   matrix_item = getOption("default_matrix_item"),   tsmatrix_series = getOption("default_tsmatrix_series"),   paths_path = NULL,   v3 = getOption("is_cruncher_v3"),   file_param = file.path(dir_file_param, "parameters.param") )

title: Create parameter file for the 'JWSACruncher' — create_param_file
text: dir_file_param Path directory contains parameter file "parameters.param" (file_param supplied). bundle Maximum size group series (output). default bundle = 10000. csv_layout Layout CSV files (series ). default csv_layout = "list". options: csv_layout = "vtable" (vertical table) csv_layout = "htable" (horizontal table). csv_separator field separator string used CSV file. default csv_separator = ";". ndecs Number decimals used output. default ndec = 6. full_series_name Boolean indicating fully qualified name series used (default full_series_name = TRUE) name series  displayed. used v3 = TRUE. short_column_headers Boolean indicating full column names printed (default short_column_headers = TRUE) instead always outputting shortened ones. used v3 = TRUE (since v.3.4.0). rslt_name_level used v3 = TRUE. policy Refreshing policy processing. default policy = "parameters" (re-estimation coefficients reg-ARIMA model, see details). refreshall Boolean indicating data refreshed (default refreshall = TRUE). output Full path output folder. default (output = NULL) folder create path workspace ([workspace]/Output). matrix_item Character containing items matrix output (see 'JDemetra+' manual information). default, items defined option getOption("default_matrix_item") used (option initialized default output 'JWSACruncher' 2.2.2). tsmatrix_series Character containing names times series export (see 'JDemetra+' manual information).  default, items defined option getOption("default_tsmatrix_series") used (option initialized default output 'JWSACruncher' 2.2.2). paths_path paths used relative addresses (see "Demetra Paths" graphical interface 'JDemetra+'). v3 Boolean indicating parameter file compatible version 3.0.0 higher 'JWSACRuncher' (v3 = TRUE) lower version (v3 = FALSE). default value option "is_cruncher_v3" used. file_param Path parameters file. default file named parameters.param created fir_file_param directory.

title: Create parameter file for the 'JWSACruncher' — create_param_file
text: Path parameter file.

title: Create parameter file for the 'JWSACruncher' — create_param_file
text: 'JWSACruncher' launched, data refreshed specific policy defined parameter policy. available options : policy = "current": estimations fixed AO added new data (since v.2.2.3), short name policy = "n"; policy = "fixed": estimations fixed (since v.2.2.3), short name policy = "f"; policy = "fixedparameters": re-estimation coefficients regression variables (ARIMA coefficients), short name policy = "fp"; policy = "fixedarparameters": re-estimation coefficients regression variables MA coefficients ARIMA model (AR coefficients), short name policy = "farp" (since v.3.4.0); policy = "parameters" (default): policy = "fixedparameters" + re-estimation ARIMA coefficients, short name policy = "p"; policy = "lastoutliers": policy = "parameters" + re-identification last outliers (last year), short name policy = "l"; policy = "outliers": policy = "lastoutliers" + re-identification outliers, short name policy = "o"; policy = "stochastic": policy = "outliers" + re-identification ARIMA orders, short name policy = "s"; policy = "complete" policy = "concurrent": model completely re-identified re-estimated, short name policy = "c".

title: Create parameter file for the 'JWSACruncher' — create_param_file
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ dir = tempdir() # Here a file parameters.param is created in the directory dir # with default parameters of the different options create_param_file(dir) # to only export the raw and the seasonally adjusted series  create_param_file(dir,                     tsmatrix_series = c("y", "sa")) } # }

title: Run the 'JWSACruncher' — cruncher
text: Function run 'JWSACruncher' workspace parameter file.

title: Run the 'JWSACruncher' — cruncher
code: cruncher(   workspace,   cruncher_bin_directory = getOption("cruncher_bin_directory"),   param_file_path,   log_file = NULL,   rename_multi_documents = FALSE,   delete_existing_file = FALSE )

title: Run the 'JWSACruncher' — cruncher
text: workspace Path workspace. default dialog box opens choose workspace. cruncher_bin_directory Path "bin" directory 'JWSACruncher'. default value option "cruncher_bin_directory" used. param_file_path Path parameter file 'JWSACruncher'. default .params file search save directory workspace. log_file Name log file 'JWSACruncher'. default log exported. rename_multi_documents Boolean indicating whether rename folders containing outputs according names multi-documents workspace. default rename_multi_documents = FALSE: names XML files multi-documents used. delete_existing_file used rename_multi_documents = TRUE. Boolean indicating whether delete existing folders renaming . default (delete_existing_file = FALSE) deleted.

title: Run the 'JWSACruncher' — cruncher
text: path workspace.

title: Run the 'JWSACruncher' — cruncher
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ dir = tempdir() # First create a parameter file # here a file parameters.param is created in the directory dir # with default parameters of 'JWSACruncher' v2 list2param_file(dir, default_param_file(v3 = FALSE)) # If the option "cruncher_bin_directory" is correctly defined: cruncher("workspace.xml",           param_file_path = file.path(dir, "parameters.param")) } # }

title: Run quickly the 'JWSACruncher' — cruncher_and_param
text: Function run 'JWSACruncher' workspace creating parameter file.

title: Run quickly the 'JWSACruncher' — cruncher_and_param
code: cruncher_and_param(   workspace = NULL,   output = NULL,   rename_multi_documents = FALSE,   delete_existing_file = FALSE,   log_file = NULL,   cruncher_bin_directory = getOption("cruncher_bin_directory"),   ... )

title: Run quickly the 'JWSACruncher' — cruncher_and_param
text: workspace Path workspace. default dialog box opens choose workspace. output Full path output folder. default (output = NULL) folder create path workspace ([workspace]/Output). rename_multi_documents Boolean indicating whether rename folders containing outputs according names multi-documents workspace. default rename_multi_documents = FALSE: names XML files multi-documents used. delete_existing_file used rename_multi_documents = TRUE. Boolean indicating whether delete existing folders renaming . default (delete_existing_file = FALSE) deleted. log_file Name log file 'JWSACruncher'. default log exported. cruncher_bin_directory Path "bin" directory 'JWSACruncher'. default value option "cruncher_bin_directory" used. ... parameters create_param_file().

title: Run quickly the 'JWSACruncher' — cruncher_and_param
text: Path workspace.

what: Get default parameters of the 'JWSACruncher' — default_param_file
title: Get default parameters of the 'JWSACruncher' — default_param_file
text: Get default parameters 'JWSACruncher'

title: Get default parameters of the 'JWSACruncher' — default_param_file
code: default_param_file(   v3 = getOption("is_cruncher_v3"),   cruncher_bin_directory = NULL )

title: Get default parameters of the 'JWSACruncher' — default_param_file
text: v3 Boolean indicating parameters version 3.0.0 higher 'JWSACRuncher' (v3 = TRUE) lower version (v3 = FALSE). default value option "is_cruncher_v3" used. cruncher_bin_directory Path directory contains 'JWSACruncher' binary. defined, parameter v3 ignored 'JWSACruncher' run without  parameter generate default parameters file.

title: Dowload the 'JWSACruncher' — download_cruncher
text: Function download ZIP file 'JWSACruncher' (download_cruncher()) 'JDemetra+' (download_jdemetra()).

title: Dowload the 'JWSACruncher' — download_cruncher
code: download_cruncher(   directory,   cruncher_version = NULL,   v3 = getOption("is_cruncher_v3"),   standalone = FALSE )  download_jdemetra(   directory,   cruncher_version = NULL,   v3 = getOption("is_cruncher_v3"),   standalone = FALSE )

title: Dowload the 'JWSACruncher' — download_cruncher
text: directory Directory save file. Windows, dialog box opens default select directory. cruncher_version Character version download ("X.Y.Z" format). default last version downloaded. v3 Boolean indicating, parameter cruncher_version missing, last version 'JWSACruncher' 3.x.y version 2.x.y. default value option "is_cruncher_v3" used. standalone Boolean indicating standalone version downloaded (available v3 = TRUE).

title: Dowload the 'JWSACruncher' — download_cruncher
text: 'JWSACruncher' downloaded https://github.com/jdemetra/jwsacruncher/releases versions lower 3.0.0 https://github.com/jdemetra/jdplus-main/releases versions. use , unzip.

title: Dowload the 'JWSACruncher' — download_cruncher
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # On Windows opens a dialog box to choose the directory where to # download the last version of the 'JWSACruncher' download_cruncher()  dir <- tempdir() # To download the last release: download_cruncher(dir)  # To download the release of the version 2.2.2: download_cruncher(dir, "2.2.2") } # }

what: Create parameter file from list — list2param_file
title: Create parameter file from list — list2param_file
text: Create parameter file list

title: Create parameter file from list — list2param_file
code: list2param_file(   dir_file_param,   x,   file_param = file.path(dir_file_param, "parameters.param") )

title: Create parameter file from list — list2param_file
text: dir_file_param Path directory contains parameter file "parameters.param" (file_param supplied). x list, example create read_param_file() default_param_file(). file_param Path parameters file. default file named parameters.param created fir_file_param directory.

title: Create parameter file from list — list2param_file
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ dir = tempdir() # Here a file parameters.param is created in the directory dir # with default parameters of 'JWSACruncher' v2 list_param <- default_param_file(v3 = FALSE) list2param_file(dir, list_param) # to only export the raw and the seasonally adjusted series list_param$tsmatrix_series <- c("y", "sa") list2param_file(dir, list_param) } # }

title: Get the names of the multiprocessings of a workspace — multiprocessing_names

title: Read parameter file of the 'JWSACruncher' — read_param_file
text: file Path parameter file.

title: Read parameter file of the 'JWSACruncher' — read_param_file
code: dir = tempdir() list_param <- default_param_file(v3 = FALSE) list2param_file(dir, list_param) list_param_2 <- read_param_file(file.path(dir, "parameters.param")) all.equal(list_param, list_param_2) #> [1] TRUE

title: Update a workspace — update_workspace
text: Function update workspace without exporting results.

title: Update a workspace — update_workspace
code: update_workspace(   workspace = NULL,   policy = "parameters",   cruncher_bin_directory = getOption("cruncher_bin_directory"),   log_file = NULL )

title: Update a workspace — update_workspace
text: workspace Path workspace. default dialog box opens choose workspace. policy Refreshing policy processing. default policy = "parameters" (re-estimation coefficients reg-ARIMA model, see details). cruncher_bin_directory Path "bin" directory 'JWSACruncher'. default value option "cruncher_bin_directory" used. log_file Name log file 'JWSACruncher'. default log exported.

title: Update a workspace — update_workspace
text: Path workspace.

title: rjwsacruncher 0.2.3
text: add new parameter standalone download_cruncher(). startup message added indicating version JWSACruncher used default (defined option "is_cruncher_v3"). new function download_jdemetra() download JDemetra+ software. improve cruncher() function handle case cruncher_bin_directory parameter provided correspond path JWSACruncher instead bin directory. improve error message create_param_file() dir_file_param parameter doesn’t correspond existing directory.

title: rjwsacruncher 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2025-07-18 add new parameter short_column_headers create_param_file(). correction default_param_file() cruncher_bin_directory defined. correction read_param_file() converting full_series_name parameter FALSE. default parameter file ‘JWSACruncher’ already exists, default_param_file() erase delete cruncher_bin_directory defined.

title: rjwsacruncher 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-02-07 parameters rename_multi_documents renaming_existing_files added cruncher() function. parameter cruncher_bin_directory added default_parameter_file() get default parameter local installation JWSACruncher. parameter file_param added create_param_file() list2param_file() able change name parameter file. documentation update add new policies.

title: rjwsacruncher 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-10-04 correction export log file relative path given. cruncher_and_param() correction linux rename_multi_documents = TRUE. download_cruncher() now compatible version higher 3.0.0. new parameters create_param_file(). new functions read_param_file(), default_param_file() list2param_file().

title: rjwsacruncher 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2022-11-11 cruncher() correction param_file_path. documentation update.

title: rjwsacruncher 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-11 Linux compatible path (PR #2).

title: rjwsacruncher 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-07-21 download_cruncher() correction. functions now compatible MAC OS Linux environment.
